		/// <summary>
		/// Get Notes by orderId
		/// Retrieves notes related to a specific `orderId`.
		/// GetNotesbyorderId notes
		/// </summary>
		/// <param name="target_id">ID of the order.</param>
		/// <param name="perPage">Number of notes per page. Maximum: 30.</param>
		/// <param name="page">Number of the page to be retrieved.</param>
		/// <param name="reason">This parameter is relevant only for PII-compliant accounts. When sending requests to this endpoint, PII-compliant accounts can use this parameter to declare the reason for requesting unmasked data. Otherwise, this endpoint will return masked PII data.</param>
		/// <returns>OK</returns>
		public async Task<object> GetNotesbyorderIdAsync(string target_id, int perPage, int page, string reason, Action<System.Net.Http.Headers.HttpRequestHeaders> handleHeaders = null)
		{

			using (var httpRequestMessage = new System.Net.Http.HttpRequestMessage(System.Net.Http.HttpMethod.Get, requestUri))
			{
			if (handleHeaders != null)
			{
				handleHeaders(httpRequestMessage.Headers);
			}

			var responseMessage = await httpClient.SendAsync(httpRequestMessage);
			try
			{
				responseMessage.EnsureSuccessStatusCodeEx();
				var responseMessageStream = await responseMessage.Content.ReadAsStreamAsync();
				using (JsonReader jsonReader = new JsonTextReader(new System.IO.StreamReader(responseMessageStream)))
				{
				var serializer = JsonSerializer.Create(jsonSerializerSettings);
				return serializer.Deserialize<object>(jsonReader);
				}
			}
			finally
			{
				responseMessage.Dispose();
			}
			}
		}
		
		/// <summary>
		/// Create Note
		/// This endpoint creates a new note in VTEX DO. Be aware of the following limitations:
		/// 
		/// - The maximum number of notes for an order is 30.
		/// 
		/// - The maximum number of characters in a note's description is 2000.
		/// NewNote notes
		/// </summary>
		/// <returns>OK</returns>
		public async Task<object> NewNoteAsync(NewNotePostBody requestBody, Action<System.Net.Http.Headers.HttpRequestHeaders> handleHeaders = null)

			}

		/// <summary>
		/// List tasks
		/// This endpoint allows you to filter tasks. You can choose between the following filtering options:
		/// 
		/// - **Assignees:** using `assignee.email` and `status`. Example: `https://{{accountName}}.{{environment}}.com.br/api/do/tasks?assignee.email={{person@email.com}}&status={{open}}`.
		/// 
		/// - **Targets:** using `targetId` and `status`. Example: `https://{{accountName}}.{{environment}}.com.br/api/do/tasks?target.id={{name}}&status={{open}}`.
		/// 
		/// - **Paged tasks:** using `page`, `perPage` and `status`. Example: `https://{{accountName}}.{{environment}}.com.br/api/do/tasks?page={{1}}&perPage={{10}}&status=;{{-Closed}}`.
		/// 
		/// - **Context:** using `context`, `page`, `perPage` and `status`. Example: `https://{{accountName}}.{{environment}}.com.br/api/do/tasks?context={{context}}&page={{1}}&perPage={{10}}&status={{-Closed}}`.
		/// Listtasksbyassignee tasks
		/// </summary>
		/// <param name="assignee_email">If you wish to list tasks by assignee, insert the desired assignee's email and status.</param>
		/// <param name="target_id">If you wish to list tasks by target, insert the desired `targetId` and `status`.</param>
		/// <param name="context">If you wish to list tasks by context, insert the desired context, `page`, `perPage` and `status`.</param>
		/// <param name="page">If you wish to list tasks by context, also insert the desired `page`.</param>
		/// <param name="perPage">If you wish to list tasks by context, also insert the desired `perPage` value.</param>
		/// <param name="status">If you wish to list tasks by context, also insert the desired `status`.</param>
		/// <returns>OK</returns>
		public async Task<object> ListtasksbyassigneeAsync(string assignee_email, string target_id, string context, string page, string perPage, string status, Action<System.Net.Http.Headers.HttpRequestHeaders> handleHeaders = null)
		{
			var requestUri = "tasks?assignee.email=" + (assignee_email==null? "" : System.Uri.EscapeDataString(assignee_email))+"&target.id=" + (target_id==null? "" : System.Uri.EscapeDataString(target_id))+"&context=" + (context==null? "" : System.Uri.EscapeDataString(context))+"&page=" + (page==null? "" : System.Uri.EscapeDataString(page))+"&perPage=" + (perPage==null? "" : System.Uri.EscapeDataString(perPage))+"&status=" + (status==null? "" : System.Uri.EscapeDataString(status));
			using (var httpRequestMessage = new System.Net.Http.HttpRequestMessage(System.Net.Http.HttpMethod.Get, requestUri))
			{

				handleHeaders(httpRequestMessage.Headers);
			}

		/// <summary>
		/// Add Comment on a Task
		/// Adds a comment to a given task, filtering by `taskId`.
		/// AddComment tasks/{taskId}/comments
		/// </summary>
		/// <param name="taskId">Task ID.</param>
		/// <returns>OK</returns>
		public async Task<object> AddCommentAsync(string taskId, AddCommentRequest requestBody, Action<System.Net.Http.Headers.HttpRequestHeaders> handleHeaders = null)

	public class NewNotePostBody
	{
		
		/// <summary>
		/// Note description. Maximum number of characters: 2000.
		/// Required
		/// </summary>
		[System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.Required()]
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="description")]
		public string Description { get; set; }
		
		/// <summary>
		/// Note domain.
		/// Required
		/// </summary>
		[System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.Required()]
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="domain")]
		public string Domain { get; set; }
		
		/// <summary>
		/// Target.
		/// Required
		/// </summary>
		[System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.Required()]
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="target")]
		public NewNotePostBodyTarget Target { get; set; }
	}
	
	public class NewNotePostBodyTarget
	{
		
		/// <summary>
		/// Target ID.
		/// </summary>
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="id")]
		public string Id { get; set; }
		
		/// <summary>
		/// Target type.
		/// </summary>
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="type")]
		public string Type { get; set; }
		
		/// <summary>
		/// Target URL.
		/// </summary>
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="url")]
		public string Url { get; set; }
	}
}

namespace Fonlow.Net.Http
{
	using System.Net.Http;

	public class WebApiRequestException : HttpRequestException
	{
		public System.Net.HttpStatusCode StatusCode { get; private set; }

		public string Response { get; private set; }

		public System.Net.Http.Headers.HttpResponseHeaders Headers { get; private set; }

		public System.Net.Http.Headers.MediaTypeHeaderValue ContentType { get; private set; }

		public WebApiRequestException(string message, System.Net.HttpStatusCode statusCode, string response, System.Net.Http.Headers.HttpResponseHeaders headers, System.Net.Http.Headers.MediaTypeHeaderValue contentType) : base(message)
		{
			StatusCode = statusCode;
			Response = response;
			Headers = headers;
			ContentType = contentType;
		}
	}

	public static class ResponseMessageExtensions
	{
		public static void EnsureSuccessStatusCodeEx(this HttpResponseMessage responseMessage)
		{
			if (!responseMessage.IsSuccessStatusCode)
			{
				var responseText = responseMessage.Content.ReadAsStringAsync().Result;
				var contentType = responseMessage.Content.Headers.ContentType;
				throw new WebApiRequestException(responseMessage.ReasonPhrase, responseMessage.StatusCode, responseText, responseMessage.Headers, contentType);
			}
		}
	}
}
